intro: Pyrenacantha klaineana, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped white flowers. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are edible for birds. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular ornamental plant. Pyrenacantha klaineana is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators and its adaptability to various garden environments.
